cards.name: Ajani, Mentor of Heroes
cards.text:
+1: Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures you control.
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an Aura, creature, or planeswalker card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
−8: You gain 100 life.

rulings.text: You announce how many counters will be placed on each target creature as you activate Ajani's first ability. Each target must receive at least one counter.

If one or more, but not all, of the targets of the first ability are illegal when that ability tries to resolve, no counters will be placed on illegal targets. You can't change the distribution you announced when you activated the ability; the excess counters are just lost.

cards.originalText:
+1: Distribute three +1/+1 counters among one, two, or three target creatures you control.
+1: Look at the top four cards of your library. You may reveal an Aura, creature, or planeswalker card from among them and put it into your hand. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in any order.
-8: You gain 100 life.

cards.name: Athreos, God of Passage
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to white and black is less than seven, Athreos isn't a creature.
Whenever another creature you own dies, return it to your hand unless target opponent pays 3 life.

rulings.text: You are a creature's owner if the card representing it began the game in your deck, or if it's a token that entered the battlefield under your control.
Athreos's last ability will trigger if a token creature you own dies. The target opponent has the option to pay 3 life, although the token can't return to your hand.
It doesn't matter who controlled the creature when it died. Athreos's last ability will trigger if you owned that creature.

The target opponent chooses whether to pay 3 life when Athreos's last ability resolves. You won't return the card to your hand if that player pays 3 life or if the card leaves the graveyard before the ability resolves.

If there are no legal targets for Athreos's last ability (perhaps because each of your opponents has hexproof), it will be removed from the stack with no effect. No one may pay 3 life and you won't return the creature card to your hand.
The type-changing ability that can make the God not be a creature functions only on the battlefield. It's always a creature card in other zones, regardless of your devotion to its color.

If a God enters the battlefield, your devotion to its color (including the mana symbols in the mana cost of the God itself) will determine if a creature entered the battlefield or not, for abilities that trigger whenever a creature enters the battlefield.
If a God stops being a creature, it loses the type creature and all creature subtypes. It continues to be a legendary enchantment.
The abilities of Gods function as long as they're on the battlefield, regardless of whether they're creatures.
If a God is attacking or blocking and it stops being a creature, it will be removed from combat.

If a God is dealt damage, then stops being a creature, then becomes a creature again later in the same turn, the damage will still be marked on it. This is also true for any effects that were affecting the God when it was originally a creature. (Note that in most cases, the damage marked on the God won't matter because it has indestructible.)

Your devotion to two colors is equal to the number of mana symbols that are the first color, the second color, or both colors among the mana costs of permanents you control. Specifically, a hybrid mana symbol counts only once toward your devotion to its two colors. For example, if the only nonland permanents you control are Pharika, God of Affliction and Golgari Guildmage (whose mana cost is {B/G}{B/G}), your devotion to black and green is four.
Numeric mana symbols ({0}, {1}, and so on) in mana costs of permanents you control don't count toward your devotion to any color.
Mana symbols in the text boxes of permanents you control don't count toward your devotion to any color.
Hybrid mana symbols, monocolored hybrid mana symbols, and Phyrexian mana symbols do count toward your devotion to their color(s).

foreignNames.name: 通行の神、エイスリオス

cards.originalText:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to white and black is less than seven, Athreos isn't a creature.
Whenever another creature you own dies, return it to your hand unless target opponent pays 3 life.

cards.name: Desperate Stand
cards.text:
Strive — This spell costs {R}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain first strike and vigilance until end of turn.
cards.flavor: At the Akroan gates, hoplites revived the tactics of Kytheon Iora's infamous irregulars.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets each spell with a strive ability has and what those targets are as you cast it. It's legal to cast such a spell with no targets, although this is rarely a good idea. You can't choose the same target more than once for a single strive spell.
The mana cost and converted mana cost of strive spells don't change no matter how many targets they have. Strive abilities affect only what you pay.

If all of the spell's targets are illegal when the spell tries to resolve, it won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. If one or more of its targets are legal when it tries to resolve, the spell will resolve and affect only those legal targets. It will have no effect on any illegal targets.

If such a spell is copied, and the effect that copies the spell allows a player to choose new targets for the copy, the number of targets can't be changed. The player may change any number of the targets, including all of them or none of them. If, for one of the targets, the player can't choose a new legal target, then it remains unchanged (even if the current target is illegal).
If a spell or ability allows you to cast a strive spell without paying its mana cost, you must pay the additional costs for any targets beyond the first.

cards.originalText:
Strive — Desperate Stand costs {R}{W} more to cast for each target beyond the first.
Any number of target creatures each get +2/+0 and gain first strike and vigilance until end of turn.

cards.name: Disciple of Deceit
cards.text: Inspired — Whenever Disciple of Deceit becomes untapped, you may discard a nonland card. If you do, search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: If there's an {X} in the mana cost of the card you discarded or the card you wish to search for, X is 0.
Inspired abilities trigger no matter how the creature becomes untapped: by the turn-based action at the beginning of the untap step or by a spell or ability.

If an inspired ability triggers during your untap step, the ability will be put on the stack at the beginning of your upkeep. If the ability creates one or more token creatures, those creatures won't be able to attack that turn (unless they gain haste).
Inspired abilities don't trigger when the creature enters the battlefield.
If the inspired ability includes an optional cost, you decide whether to pay that cost as the ability resolves. You can do this even if the creature leaves the battlefield in response to the ability.
The converted mana cost of a split card is determined by the combined mana cost of its two halves.

cards.originalText: Inspired — Whenever Disciple of Deceit becomes untapped, you may discard a nonland card. If you do, search your library for a card with the same converted mana cost as that card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Fleetfeather Cockatrice
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying, deathtouch
{5}{G}{U}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

rulings.text: Once a creature becomes monstrous, it can't become monstrous again. If the creature is already monstrous when the monstrosity ability resolves, nothing happens.
Monstrous isn't an ability that a creature has. It's just something true about that creature. If the creature stops being a creature or loses its abilities, it will continue to be monstrous.
An ability that triggers when a creature becomes monstrous won't trigger if that creature isn't on the battlefield when its monstrosity ability resolves.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
Flying, deathtouch
{5}{G}{U}: Monstrosity 3. (If this creature isn't monstrous, put three +1/+1 counters on it and it becomes monstrous.)

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attacking creatures you control.

Hybrid mana symbols, monocolored hybrid mana symbols, and Phyrexian mana symbols do count toward your devotion to their color(s).

Prevent all damage that would be dealt to attacking creatures you control.

Reveal the first card you draw on each of your turns. Whenever you reveal a land card this way, draw a card. Whenever you reveal a nonland card this way, Keranos deals 3 damage to any target.

cards.name: Kruphix, God of Horizons
cards.text:
Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and blue is less than seven, Kruphix isn't a creature.
You have no maximum hand size.
If you would lose unspent mana, that mana becomes colorless instead.

rulings.text: As long as Kruphix is on the battlefield, unused mana will remain in your mana pool as steps and phases end (although it will become colorless). This means you can add mana to your mana pool and spend it during a future step, phase, or turn. Once Kruphix leaves the battlefield, you have until the end of the current step or phase to use the mana before it disappears.

If unused mana in your mana pool has any restrictions or riders associated with it (for example, if it was produced by Cavern of Souls), those restrictions or riders will remain associated with that mana when it becomes colorless.
The type-changing ability that can make the God not be a creature functions only on the battlefield. It's always a creature card in other zones, regardless of your devotion to its color.

If a God enters the battlefield, your devotion to its color (including the mana symbols in the mana cost of the God itself) will determine if a creature entered the battlefield or not, for abilities that trigger whenever a creature enters the battlefield.

Mana symbols in the text boxes of permanents you control don't count toward your devotion to any color.
Hybrid mana symbols, monocolored hybrid mana symbols, and Phyrexian mana symbols do count toward your devotion to their color(s).

Indestructible
As long as your devotion to green and blue is less than seven, Kruphix isn't a creature.
You have no maximum hand size.

{B}{G}: Exile target creature card from a graveyard. Its owner puts a 1/1 black and green Snake enchantment creature token with deathtouch onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Revel of the Fallen God
cards.text: Create four 2/2 red and green Satyr creature tokens with haste.
cards.flavor:
"Xenagos has fallen, and the world grows dark without him. What can ever fill that darkness but our rage?"
—Guruthes, disciple of Xenagos
cards.originalText: Put four 2/2 red and green Satyr creature tokens with haste onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Stormchaser Chimera
cards.text:
Flying
{2}{U}{R}: Scry 1, then reveal the top card of your library. Stormchaser Chimera gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
{2}{U}{R}: Scry 1, then reveal the top card of your library. Stormchaser Chimera gets +X/+0 until end of turn, where X is that card's converted mana cost. (To scry 1, look at the top card of your library, then you may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Underworld Coinsmith
cards.text:
Constellation — Whenever Underworld Coinsmith or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{W}{B}, Pay 1 life: Each opponent loses 1 life.
cards.flavor: Coins of the Underworld are shaped from clay funerary masks.

rulings.text: A constellation ability triggers whenever an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control for any reason. Enchantments with other card types, such as enchantment creatures, will also cause constellation abilities to trigger.

An Aura spell without bestow that has an illegal target when it tries to resolve won't resolve and put into its owner's graveyard. It won't enter the battlefield and constellation abilities won't trigger. An Aura spell with bestow won't be countered this way. It will revert to being an enchantment creature and resolve, entering the battlefield and triggering constellation abilities.

When an enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, each constellation ability of permanents you control will trigger. You can put these abilities on the stack in any order. The last ability you put on the stack will be the first one that resolves.

cards.originalText:
Constellation — Whenever Underworld Coinsmith or another enchantment enters the battlefield under your control, you gain 1 life.
{W}{B}, Pay 1 life: Each opponent loses 1 life.

cards.name: Armory of Iroas
cards.text:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Equip {2}
cards.flavor: From a distance the weapons look pristine, but in fact they are tarnished and dented, each as unique as the champion who carried it to battle.

rulings.text: The +1/+1 counter is put on the equipped creature before combat damage is dealt.
If you move Armory of Iroas from one creature to another, any +1/+1 counters on the first creature remain where they are.

cards.originalText:
Whenever equipped creature attacks, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
Equip {2}

cards.name: Chariot of Victory
cards.text:
Equipped creature has first strike, trample, and haste.
Equip {1}
cards.flavor: The greatest heroes are the first to stand, the first to take up arms, and the first to meet the enemy.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature has first strike, trample, and haste.
Equip {1}

cards.name: Deserter's Quarters
cards.text:
You may choose not to untap Deserter's Quarters during your untap step.
{6}, {T}: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Deserter's Quarters remains tapped.
cards.flavor: In Akros, the penalty for running from battle is one night's stay in the Deserter's Quarters.

rulings.text: The activated ability can target any creature, not just one that's untapped.

As long as Deserter's Quarters remains tapped, the effect stopping the creature from untapping during its controller's untap step remains even if that creature untaps some other way (for example, with Colossal Heroics).

cards.originalText:
You may choose not to untap Deserter's Quarters during your untap step.
{6}, {T}: Tap target creature. It doesn't untap during its controller's untap step for as long as Deserter's Quarters remains tapped.

cards.name: Gold-Forged Sentinel
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Blessed by the gods. Coveted by mortals. Beholden to neither.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Hall of Triumph
cards.text:
As Hall of Triumph enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Heroes act without thought of glory or reward. Accolades are a consequence, not a goal.
cards.originalText:
As Hall of Triumph enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Creatures you control of the chosen color get +1/+1.

cards.name: Mana Confluence
cards.text: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color.
cards.flavor: Five rivers encircle Theros, flowing with waters more ancient than the world itself.
cards.originalText: {T}, Pay 1 life: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool.

Temple of Epiphany enters the battlefield tapped.
When Temple of Epiphany enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {U} or {R}.
cards.originalText:

When Temple of Epiphany enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)
{T}: Add {U} or {R} to your mana pool.

When Temple of Malady enters the battlefield, scry 1. (Look at the top card of your library. You may put that card on the bottom of your library.)

cards.name: Alabaster Potion
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains X life.
• Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity."
—D'Avenant proverb
cards.originalText: Target player gains X life, or prevent X damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Battering Ram
cards.text:
At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.)
Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.
cards.flavor: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText:
Banding when attacking
Whenever a wall blocks Battering Ram, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Bog Imp
cards.text: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
cards.flavor: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Bog Wraith
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae
My mate did meet an early grave
'Twas nothing left for us to save
In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from one black source. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Red
cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn't need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.originalText: {1}: Prevent all damage to you from one red source. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

cards.name: Clockwork Beast
cards.text:
Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it.
At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it.
{X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

rulings.text: Loses a counter even if it is affected by a Fog-like effect which prevents it from dealing damage.
Can attack or block even if it has no counters.
This is a change from the most recent wording. Now, if some other spell or ability causes +1/+0 counters to be put on Clockwork Beast, it can wind up with more than seven such counters on it.

If Clockwork Beast has seven or fewer +1/+0 counters on it when its last ability resolves, it can wind up a maximum of seven such counters on it. If it has seven or more +1/+0 counters on it, the ability will have no effect.
Clockwork Beast's last ability resolves, you can choose to put fewer than X +1/+0 counters on it.

cards.originalText: Put seven +1/+0 counters on Beast. After Beast attacks or blocks a creature, discard a counter. During the untap phase, controller may buy back lost counters for 1 mana per counter instead of tapping Beast; this taps Beast if it wasn't tapped already.

cards.name: Cursed Land
cards.text:
Enchant land
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted land's controller, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: During enchanted land's controller's upkeep, Cursed Land deals 1 damage to the player.

cards.name: Dark Ritual
cards.text: Add {B}{B}{B} to your mana pool.
cards.originalText: Add 3 black mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Detonate
cards.text: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

rulings.text: If the artifact becomes an illegal target before resolution, then no damage is done.

cards.originalText: Bury target artifact with casting cost equal to X. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

cards.name: Disintegrate
cards.text: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

rulings.text: The "can't regenerate" is an effect of Disintegrate and not an effect of the damage. It works even if the damage is prevented or redirected. If redirected, the damage does not take this effect with it.
Disintegrated creatures do not go to the graveyard at all before being exiled. They do not trigger abilities which trigger due to a creature going to the graveyard.

cards.originalText: Disintegrate deals X damage to target creature or player. That creature cannot regenerate until end of turn. If the creature is dealt lethal damage this turn, remove it from the game.

cards.name: Durkwood Boars
cards.flavor:
"And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ."
—Mark 5:13

cards.name: Elven Riders
cards.text: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm."
—Elven proverb

rulings.text: Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don't actually have Flying, so they can't block this.

cards.originalText: Elven Riders cannot be blocked except by creatures with flying or walls.

cards.name: Elvish Archers
cards.text: First strike
cards.flavor: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"
cards.originalText: First strike

cards.name: Energy Flux
cards.text: All artifacts have "At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice this artifact unless you pay {2}."
cards.originalText: All artifacts in play gain "During your upkeep, pay an additional {2} or bury this artifact."

cards.name: Feedback
cards.text:
Enchant enchantment
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted enchantment's controller, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: During enchanted enchantment's controller's upkeep, Feedback deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Fireball
cards.text:
Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of target creatures and/or players.
Fireball costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first.

rulings.text: For example, if X is 5 and you choose three target creatures, Fireball has a total cost of {7}{R} (even though its mana cost is just {5}{R} and its converted mana cost is 6). If those creatures are all still legal targets as Fireball resolves, it deals 1 damage to each of them.
You may cast Fireball with zero targets, regardless of the value chosen for X. If you do so, it will not be a targeted spell, and no damage will actually be dealt when it resolves.
Fireball's damage is divided as Fireball resolves, not as it's cast, because there are no choices involved. The division involves only targets that are still legal as Fireball resolves.
You can target more than X creatures. However, if the number of legal targets at the time Fireball resolves is greater than X, none of them will be dealt any damage.

cards.originalText: Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, round down, among any number of target creatures and/or players. Pay an additional {1} for each target beyond the first.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: Tap to add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Glasses of Urza
cards.text: {T}: Look at target player's hand.
cards.originalText: You may look at opponent's hand.

cards.name: Grizzly Bears
cards.flavor: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to target creature or player this turn.
cards.originalText: Target player gains 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Hill Giant
cards.flavor: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

cards.name: Ironclaw Orcs
cards.text: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.
cards.flavor: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.
cards.originalText: Ironclaw Orcs cannot be assigned to block any creature with power 2 or greater.

cards.name: Island
cards.originalText: Tap to add {U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Lost Soul
cards.text: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)
cards.flavor:
Her hand gently beckons,
she whispers your name—
But those who go with her
are never the same.
cards.originalText: Swampwalk

cards.name: Merfolk of the Pearl Trident
cards.flavor: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, flying

cards.name: Mons's Goblin Raiders
cards.flavor: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

cards.name: Mountain
cards.originalText: Tap to add {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Murk Dwellers
cards.text: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.
cards.flavor: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.

cards.originalText: If Murk Dwellers attacks and is not blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

cards.name: Orcish Artillery
cards.text: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to target creature or player and 3 damage to you.
cards.flavor: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

rulings.text: You do not take the 3 points of damage if the ability is countered because the target is illegal.

cards.originalText: Tap to do 2 damage to any target, but you suffer 3 damage as well.

cards.name: Orcish Oriflamme
cards.text: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.
cards.originalText: When attacking, all of your attacking creatures gain +1/+0.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Phantom Monster
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor:
"While, like a ghastly rapid river,
Through the pale door,
A hideous throng rush out forever,
And laugh—but smile no more."
—Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Plains
cards.originalText: Tap to add {W} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Power Sink
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}. If he or she doesn't, that player taps all lands with mana abilities he or she controls and empties his or her mana pool.

rulings.text: Does not increase the mana cost of the spell. It just requires a separate expenditure in order for it to succeed.

When this spell resolves, you either pay X mana or let your lands become tapped. The lands that become tapped are not "tapped for mana". If you choose to pay, you may pay the X mana using whatever mana abilities you want to use.

Only lands that actually have mana abilities will get tapped. This includes basic lands and lands with mana abilities printed on them, as well as lands which have been granted a mana ability by some effect.

cards.originalText: Counter target spell unless that spell's caster pays an additional {X}. That player draws and pays all available mana from lands and mana pool until {X} is paid; he or she may also draw and pay mana from other sources if desired.

cards.name: Pyrotechnics
cards.text: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.
cards.flavor:
"Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me!
Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return." —Navajo war chant

rulings.text: The number of targets chosen for Pyrotechnics must be at least one and at most four. You choose how the damage is divided as you cast the spell, not as it resolves. Each target must be assigned at least 1 damage.
If some but not all of Pyrotechnics's targets become illegal, you can't change the division of damage. Damage that would have been dealt to illegal targets simply isn't dealt.

You can't deal damage to both a player and a planeswalker that player controls using Pyrotechnics. You also can't deal damage to more than one planeswalker controlled by the same player. If you choose to redirect the damage being dealt to a player to a planeswalker, you must redirect all the damage to a single planeswalker.
If an effect creates a copy of Pyrotechnics, the number of targets and division of damage can't be changed. The effect that creates the copy may allow you to change the targets, however.

cards.originalText: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided any way you choose among any number of target creatures and/or players.

cards.name: Raise Dead
cards.text: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

rulings.text: You must show the card you bring out of the graveyard to your opponent.
The creature being brought back is chosen on announcement and not on resolution of the spell because it is targeted.
A "creature card" is any card with the type creature, even if it has other types such as artifact, enchantment, or land. Older cards of type summon are also creature cards.

cards.originalText: Put target creature card from your graveyard into your hand.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.originalText: All damage dealt to you frmo one source this turn is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted from it. Further damage from that source is treated normally.

cards.name: Rod of Ruin
cards.text: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
cards.originalText: {3}: Rod of Ruin does 1 damage to any target.

cards.name: Scathe Zombies
cards.flavor: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose,/ Nor spake, nor moved their eyes;/ It had been strange, even in a dream,/ To have seen those dead men rise."/ —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

cards.name: Scryb Sprites
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Sorceress Queen
cards.text: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.
cards.originalText: {T}: Make another creature 0/2 until end of turn. Treat this exactly as if the numbers in the lower right of the target card were 0/2. All special characteristics and enchantments on the creature are unaffected.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: Tap to add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Terror
cards.text: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.
cards.originalText: Destroys target creature without possibility of regeneration. Does not affect black creatures and artifact creatures.

cards.name: Twiddle
cards.text: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

rulings.text: This is not a toggle effect. If you use Twiddle to tap a card and before it takes effect your opponent taps it, Twiddle will not automatically untap the card.
The decision whether or not to tap or untap is made on resolution. This is not a modal spell.

cards.originalText: Tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

cards.name: Unsummon
cards.text: Return target creature to its owner's hand.
cards.originalText: Return creature to owner's hand; enchantments on creature are discarded. Unsummon cannot be played during the damage-dealing phase of an attack.

cards.name: Untamed Wilds
cards.text: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.
Can fetch a snow land.

cards.originalText: Search your library for a basic land card and put it into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Vampire Bats
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
{B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.
cards.flavor:
"For something is amiss or out of place
When mice with wings can wear a human face."
—Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"
cards.originalText:
Flying
{B}: +1/+0 until end of turn. You cannot spend more than {B}{B} in this way each turn.

cards.name: Wall of Bone
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
{B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)
cards.flavor: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.
cards.originalText: {B}: Regenerate

cards.name: War Mammoth
cards.text: Trample
cards.flavor: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.
cards.originalText: Trample

cards.name: Warp Artifact
cards.text:
Enchant artifact
At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.
cards.originalText: During enchanted artifact's controller's upkeep, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

cards.name: Weakness
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

cards.name: Whirling Dervish
cards.text:
Protection from black
At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

rulings.text: If it damages the opponent multiple times in a turn, it gets only one +1/+1 counter at end of turn.

cards.originalText:
Protection from black
At the end of any turn in which Whirling Dervish damaged any opponent, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Winter Blast
cards.text: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.
cards.flavor: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

rulings.text: Winter Blast can target tapped creatures. If they have flying, the second part of the effect will still affect them.
Checks if the creatures are Flying on resolution and not on announcement. It's not a targeting restriction.

cards.originalText: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.

cards.name: Zephyr Falcon
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Zephyr Falcon to tap.

cards.name: Abbey Griffin
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor:
"The darkness crawls with vampires and ghouls, but we are not without allies."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch
cards.originalText: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Angel of Flight Alabaster
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target Spirit card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: She endures without Avacyn but secretly asks each soul she guides if it has seen her.

rulings.text: The Spirit card must already be in your graveyard when the ability triggers at the beginning of your upkeep. If there is no Spirit card in your graveyard when your upkeep begins, the ability will be removed from the stack with no effect.

foreignNames.name: 空翔ける雪花石の天使

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the beginning of your upkeep, return target Spirit card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Angelic Overseer
cards.text:
Flying
As long as you control a Human, Angelic Overseer has hexproof and indestructible.
cards.flavor: From mortal hope immortal power springs.

rulings.text: If you control a Human, and an effect tries to destroy each Human you control and Angelic Overseer simultaneously, Angelic Overseer won't be destroyed.

If you control a Human, and lethal damage is dealt to Angelic Overseer, that damage will remain marked on it that turn. If later in the turn you no longer control a Human, Angelic Overseer will be destroyed.

cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as you control a Human, Angelic Overseer has hexproof and is indestructible.

cards.name: Avacynian Priest
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.
cards.flavor: Moorlanders speak in awe of the priests' talent for arriving just in time to drive off the wicked things that prowl the ravished parish.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Tap target non-Human creature.

cards.name: Bonds of Faith
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.
cards.flavor:
"What cannot be destroyed will be bound."
—Oath of Avacyn

rulings.text: Once the enchanted creature has been declared as an attacking or blocking creature, causing it to stop being a Human won't remove it from combat. It will lose the +2/+2 bonus, however.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's a Human. Otherwise, it can't attack or block.

cards.name: Champion of the Parish
cards.text: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.
cards.flavor: "I stand for every cobbler, tanner, and fool in this town—and they stand for me."
cards.originalText: Whenever another Human enters the battlefield under your control, put a +1/+1 counter on Champion of the Parish.

cards.name: Chapel Geist
cards.text: Flying
cards.flavor: Death has bound it with chains of past regrets. Forever it searches for atonement, each kindness removing a single link.
cards.originalText: Flying

cards.name: Cloistered Youth
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may transform Cloistered Youth.
cards.flavor:
"I heard her talking in her sleep—pleading, shrieking, snarling. It was not my daughter's voice. That is not my daughter."
—Ekatrin, elder of Hanweir

rulings.text: For more information on double-faced cards, see the Shadows over Innistrad mechanics article (http://magic.wizards.com/en/articles/archive/feature/shadows-over-innistrad-mechanics).

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, you may transform Cloistered Youth.

cards.name: Unholy Fiend
cards.text: At the beginning of your end step, you lose 1 life.
cards.flavor: The fiend tormented them by recounting the girl's memories, as if some part of her remained inside that twisted shell.
cards.originalText: At the beginning of your end step, you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Dearly Departed
cards.text:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor:
"Never forget our ancestors. They have not forgotten us."
—Mikaeus, the Lunarch

rulings.text: The effect is cumulative. Human creatures you control will enter the battlefield with a +1/+1 counter for each Dearly Departed in your graveyard.

In most cases, when determining whether a creature entering the battlefield under your control should get a +1/+1 counter, you'll simply look at what the creature will looklike on the battlefield. You'll consider any effects affecting a creature entering the battlefield under your control.

cards.originalText:
Flying
As long as Dearly Departed is in your graveyard, each Human creature you control enters the battlefield with an additional +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Divine Reckoning
cards.text:
Each player chooses a creature they control. Destroy the rest.
Flashback {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: Survival of the purest.

rulings.text: Starting with the player whose turn it is, each player chooses a creature in turn order. Players will know the choice of each player who chose before them.

cards.originalText:
Each player chooses a creature he or she controls. Destroy the rest.
Flashback {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Doomed Traveler
cards.text: When Doomed Traveler dies, create a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying.
cards.flavor: He vowed he would never rest until he reached his destination. He doesn't know how right he was.
cards.originalText: When Doomed Traveler dies, put a 1/1 white Spirit creature token with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Elder Cathar
cards.text: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.
cards.flavor: "My greatest hope is that you will surpass me in every way, consigning my name to some forgotten corner of history."
cards.originalText: When Elder Cathar dies, put a +1/+1 counter on target creature you control. If that creature is a Human, put two +1/+1 counters on it instead.

cards.name: Elite Inquisitor
cards.text:
First strike, vigilance
Protection from Vampires, from Werewolves, and from Zombies
cards.flavor: "No matter how many I kill, there are always more to hunt. It makes me smile just to think about it."
cards.originalText:
First strike, vigilance
Protection from Vampires, from Werewolves, and from Zombies

cards.name: Feeling of Dread
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)
cards.flavor: People only say "I'm sure it was nothing" when they're sure it was something.

rulings.text: If Feeling of Dread targets two creatures, and one of them is an illegal target by the time Feeling of Dread resolves, the other creature will still be tapped.

cards.originalText:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Flashback {1}{U} (You may cast this card from your graveyard for its flashback cost. Then exile it.)

cards.name: Fiend Hunter
cards.text:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted creature indefinitely.

Once the exiled permanent returns, it's considered a new object with no relation to the object that it was. Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.
If a token is exiled this way, it won't return to the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
When Fiend Hunter enters the battlefield, you may exile another target creature.
When Fiend Hunter leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

cards.name: Gallows Warden
cards.text:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +0/+1.
cards.flavor: The spirit cares nothing for the crimes or triumphs of the slain. It shelters all beneath its stormy cloak.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Other Spirit creatures you control get +0/+1.

cards.name: Geist-Honored Monk
cards.text:
Vigilance
Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
When Geist-Honored Monk enters the battlefield, create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.

rulings.text: The ability that defines Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness works in all zones, not just the battlefield.
As long as Geist-Honored Monk is on the battlefield, its second ability will count itself.

cards.originalText:
Vigilance
Geist-Honored Monk's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures you control.
When Geist-Honored Monk enters the battlefield, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Ghostly Possession
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.
cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by enchanted creature.

cards.name: Intangible Virtue
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.
cards.originalText: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.

cards.name: Mausoleum Guard
cards.text: When Mausoleum Guard dies, create two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying.
cards.flavor: "Ghoulcallers trying to get in, geists trying to get out . . . . This duty is never dull."
cards.originalText: When Mausoleum Guard dies, put two 1/1 white Spirit creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Mentor of the Meek
cards.text: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "In these halls there is no pass or fail. Your true test comes with the first full moon."

rulings.text: Mentor of the Meek's ability checks the power of the other creature only as it enters the battlefield. If that creature's power is 2 or less, the ability will trigger. Once the ability triggers, raising that creature's power above 2 won't affect that ability. Similarly, reducing the creature's power to 2 or less after it enters the battlefield won't cause the ability to trigger.
Apply power bonuses from counters the creature enters the battlefield with and continuous effects such as that of Valiant Knight before checking to see if Mentor of the Meek's ability will trigger.
While resolving the triggered ability of Mentor of the Meek, you can't pay {1} multiple times to draw more than one card.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature with power 2 or less enters the battlefield under your control, you may pay {1}. If you do, draw a card.
